dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Kazakhstan's Ministry of Internal Affairs is shaking things up with passport rules again.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Kazakhstan's Ministry of Internal Affairs is shaking things up with passport rules again.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Ministry of Internal Affairs has proposed changes to the rules for issuing and replacing identification documents in Kazakhstan.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, really? What's the big change this time?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, really? What's the big change this time?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Well, right now, you can hold onto your old passport until the new one's ready, unless it's damaged.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, right now, you can hold onto your old passport until the new one's ready, unless it's damaged.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Under current procedures, citizens are not required to surrender their old passports or ID cards when applying for replacements at public service centers. They may retain the old documents until the new ones are issued, except in cases where the documents are damaged or the personal data is unreadable.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, that's pretty convenient. So what are they proposing?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, that's pretty convenient. So what are they proposing?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: They want people to surrender their old passports immediately when applying for a replacement.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: They want people to surrender their old passports immediately when applying for a replacement.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The proposed changes would require citizens to surrender their passports immediately when applying for a new one.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Wait, why? That sounds like a hassle for citizens.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, why? That sounds like a hassle for citizens.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Apparently, there's been an increase in incidents where invalid documents are being reused.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Apparently, there's been an increase in incidents where invalid documents are being reused.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The ministry cited an increase in incidents involving the reuse of invalid documents.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Ah, so it's a security thing. But can you still keep it temporarily if you need to?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Ah, so it's a security thing. But can you still keep it temporarily if you need to?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, actually, if you submit a written request stating your reason, you can hang onto it until the new one is ready.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, actually, if you submit a written request stating your reason, you can hang onto it until the new one is ready.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Citizens will still have the option to keep their old passports temporarily"until the new one is ready"by submitting a written request stating the reason, the draft order says.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, that makes sense. So it's not a hard-and-fast rule, just more controlled.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, that makes sense. So it's not a hard-and-fast rule, just more controlled.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And the draft order is up for public discussion until May 26 on the Open NLA portal.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And the draft order is up for public discussion until May twenty six on the Open N L A portal.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The document has been published on the Open NLA portal for public discussion and will remain available for comments until May 26.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Interesting timing, especially since they issued a record number of passports in 2024.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Interesting timing, especially since they issued a record number of passports in twenty twenty four.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kazakhstan issued record number of passports in 2024

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right? Maybe that surge is part of why they're tightening things now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? Maybe that surge is part of why they're tightening things now.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. I wonder how people will react during the public comment period.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. I wonder how people will react during the public comment period.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, could be some pushback, but security concerns usually carry weight.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, could be some pushback, but security concerns usually carry weight.
